means: 暗杀( assassinate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The prime minister was assassinated by extremists.
Many people still remember the moment when they heard that President Kennedy had been assassinated.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多人仍然记得听到肯尼迪总统遇刺的那一刻。

sentence.Network_en: Would the USA be radically different today if Kennedy had not been assassinated?
sentence.Network_cn: 如果肯尼迪没有被暗杀，今天的美国会有根本性的不同吗？

PerfectNetExp.abs: President Lincoln was assassinated in April 1865 ., 林肯总统在 1865年 4月被暗杀.
On July 15 , 1946 , he was assassinated in Kunming by Kuomintang thugs ., 一九四六年七月十五日在昆明被国民党特务暗杀.
Officials and policemen are assassinated almost daily ., 每天几乎都有官员和警察遭到暗杀.

entry.def: When someone important is assassinated, they are murdered as a political act.

example.ex: Would the USA be radically different today if Kennedy had not been assassinated?...
example.tran: 如果肯尼迪没有被暗杀，今天的美国会有根本性的不同吗？

example.ex: The plot to assassinate Martin Luther King had started long before he was actually killed.
example.tran: 刺杀马丁·路德·金的计划在实施前酝酿已久。

means.word_mean: 1. murdered by surprise attack for political reasons;

sentences.sentence: "the 20th century has een too many assassinated leaders"
